1.text: Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.

2.text: Honour thy father and mother (which is the first commandment with promise),

3.text: that it may be well with thee, and thou mayest live long on the earth.

4.text: And, ye fathers, provoke not your children to wrath: but nurture them in the chastening and admonition of the Lord.

5.text: Servants, be obedient unto them that according to the flesh are your masters, with fear and trembling, in singleness of your heart, as unto Christ;

6.text: not in the way of eyeservice, as men-pleasers; but as servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart;

7.text: with good will doing service, as unto the Lord, and not unto men:

8.text: knowing that whatsoever good thing each one doeth, the same shall he receive again from the Lord, whether he be bond or free.

9.text: And, ye masters, do the same things unto them, and forbear threatening: knowing that both their Master and yours is in heaven, and there is no respect of persons with him.

10.text: Finally, be strong in the Lord, and in the strength of his might.

11.text: Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

12.text: For our wrestling is not against flesh and blood, but against the principalities, against the powers, against the world-rulers of this darkness, against the spiritual hosts of wickedness in the heavenly places.

13.text: Wherefore take up the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day, and, having done all, to stand.

14.text: Stand therefore, having girded your loins with truth, and having put on the breastplate of righteousness,

15.text: and having shod your feet with the preparation of the gospel of peace;

16.text: withal taking up the shield of faith, wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the evil one.

17.text: And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God:

18.text: with all prayer and supplication praying at all seasons in the Spirit, and watching thereunto in all perseverance and supplication for all the saints,

19.text: And on my behalf, that utterance may be given unto me in opening my mouth, to make known with boldness the mystery of the gospel,

20.text: for which I am an ambassador in chains; that in it I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak.

21.text: But that ye also may know my affairs, how I do, Tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord, shall make known to you all things:

22.text: whom I have sent unto you for this very purpose, that ye may know our state, and that he may comfort your hearts.

23.text: Peace be to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

24.text: Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in uncorruptness.
